data.title: Good Omens by Terry Pratchett, First Edition
data.meta_description: Good Omens *******UK HB 1/1**** by Pratchett, Terry; Gaimon, Neil and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Edition. Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman .Good omens . First u.k hardback printing - Gollancz 1990. Good jacket , priced £12.95 . Suffers from a few edge tears , creasing and rubbing . Complete apart from small chip top of spine . Some staining inside of jacket. Boards are vg and clean. Near fine contents with light page tanning. . No previous owner names or inscriptions. Solid binding and although not in pristine collectors state presents well . Very hard to find now and growing in value with the success of the TV series.

[Fantasy] FIRST EDITION. Octavo (24 x 16cm), pp.[10] 268 [2]. Publisher's red cloth with black titles to spine. With the pictorial dust-jacket by Chris Moore, printed price £12.95. No ink names. Edges a little dusty/thumbed. Jacket worn at spine ends and extremities; remains presentable. A well read/well loved (and now affordable) copy of the true first edition of this comic-fantasy, filled with all the ingredients you could want; demons, angels, serpents, bikers, a Satanic Hellhound, impending Armageddon and a used book shop! Basis for the acclaimed Amazon Prime series staring David Tennant and Michael Sheen.

Hardcover. Condition: New. Dust Jacket Condition: New. 1st Edition. EXTRAORDINARILY SCARCE SIGNED! FIRST EDITION, later printing. Book is brand new and unread. Personally hand signed by Mr. Gaiman, in his customary Sharpie, gray on black full title page. NOT a tip in. NOT a bookplate. Dust jacket hand covered in protective archival grade Mylar for many worry free years of reading/collecting! Photos available upon request. According to the Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter - the world's only totally reliable guide to the future - the world will end on a Saturday. Next Saturday, in fact. Just after tea. People have been predicting the end of the world almost from its very beginning, so it's only natural to be sceptical when a new date is set for Judgement Day. This time though, the armies of Good and Evil really do appear to be massing. The four Bikers of the Apocalypse are hitting the road. But both the angels and demons well, one fast-living demon and a somewhat fussy angel would quite like the Rapture not to happen. And someone seems to have misplaced the Antichrist. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First US Edition/Stated First Printing with the complete number line; A Near Fine book in a Near Fine dust jacket with only slight rubbing to the board edges, a mild general age-toning to the jacket, and a remainder mark to the top exterior text block. A handsome copy of this brilliantly funny novel; although the US edition followed the UK edition and book club edition, it is generally more uncommon in today's market place. Not price clipped, not ex-library; in a protective Mylar sleeve and will ship carefully wrapped in a sturdy box.

Hardcover. Condition: Excellent. First Edition. Scarce First Printing of this great collaboration. Subtitled: "The Nice & Accurate Prophecies Of Agnes Nutter, Witch". First Printing [Victor Gollancz, London, 1990]; red boards, black titling to spine, a couple of spots on foredge, slightly canted, torn with 2cm loss to top corner of title page where [presumably] production flaw glued prelims together, an excellent copy; in like, unclipped [£12.95] dustjacket, a couple tiny nicks in extremities. Brilliant meeting of minds between two great modern storytellers. With Armageddon approaching, demon Crowley & angel Aziraphale join forces to save a world that they both quite like. ISBN: 0575 04800 X / 057504800X.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Two volume hardcover set in complimentary white/black jackets that make up a set, both books are signed by Gaiman, and the copy in the white jacket is a first printing, while the book in the black jacket is a third printing. Both of the books have a slight skew to their binding, moderate bumps to their spine ends and cover corners, and a hint of rubbing with some mild edge wear to their covers. Additionally, the book in the white jacket has a short crease to the upper corner of its text block. Otherwise, this is a solid, tight, clean Very Good two volume set in like, unclipped dust jackets, which both have light bumps with minor creasing to their spine ends and corners, and mild rubbing with a touch of edge wear to the covers. The white jacket also has a few faint smudges to its covers, and a small spot to the front. The jackets are wrapped in Mylar, and additional images of the set are available upon request. slight skew moderate bumps to the spine ends and cover corners hint of rubbing and mild edge wear white jacket 1st/2006 black jacket 3rd/2008.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. A dark comedy fantasy novel about the unlikely alliance of an angel and a demon assigned to positions on Earth. When the end times approach, the pair-liking England more than the blandness of Heaven and the chaos of Hell-collude to prevent the apocalypse. This was Gaiman's first novel, and the book is one of the most beloved fantasy novels of the 1990s, lately adapted into a streaming series. 268 pages. First edition (first printing, stating "First published." with no additional printings noted). A fine copy in a fine dust jacket (perhaps there is a very slight spine lean). This copy is signed by both the late Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman. Double-signed copies are now hard to find.
